abstract.text: Squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) of the lung is the second most common subtype of lung cancer.
With limited treatment options, the 5-year survival rate of SCC is only 15%.
Although genomic alterations in SCC have been characterized, identifying the alterations that drive SCC is critical for improving treatment strategies.
Mouse models of SCC are currently limited.
Using lentiviral delivery of Sox2 specifically to the mouse lung, we tested the ability of Sox2 to promote tumorigenesis in multiple tumor suppressor backgrounds.
Expression of Sox2, frequently amplified in human SCC, specifically cooperates with loss of Lkb1 to promote squamous lung tumors.
Mouse tumors exhibit characteristic histopathology and biomarker expression similar to human SCC.
They also mimic human SCCs by activation of therapeutically relevant pathways including STAT and mTOR.
This model may be utilized to test the contribution of additional driver alterations in SCC, as well as for preclinical drug discovery.

body_text.text: INTRODUCTION
Lung cancer is a leading cause of cancer-related deaths in the United States and worldwide.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: Squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) is the second most common type of lung cancer, representing ~30% of cases and over 400,000 deaths worldwide each year (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012;Jemal et al., 2011).
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: Currently, the 5-year survival rate for SCC is approximately 15%.
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: One of the major problems contributing to treatment failure is a
body_text.section: INTRODUCTION

body_text.text: © 2014 The Authors
This is an open access article under the CC BY-NC-ND license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: lack of targeted therapies.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Targeted therapies that are effective against adenocarcinoma, the other major subtype of non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC), are ineffective or contraindicated for SCC.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: The current standard of care for SCC involves surgery when operable, or combination chemotherapy, usually a platinum doublet, which has a poor response rate (Oliver et al., 2013).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Identification of new therapeutic targets for SCC requires elucidation of the critical genes and pathways driving this disease.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network (2012) recently sequenced 178 human SCCs, identifying numerous genetic alterations that may serve as valuable therapeutic targets.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: However, SCC has one of the highest mutation rates of all tumor types, making it difficult to distinguish "driver" from "passenger" mutations.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Some genetic alterations in SCC occur in proteins for which targeted therapies are available, such as fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) and phosphatidyl inositol 3-kinase (PI3K)/ AKT.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Other potential oncogenic drivers were discovered for which there are currently no available therapies, such as the transcription factors SOX2, P63, and NRF2 (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

ref_spans.text: P63, and NRF2 (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012)

body_text.text: Mouse models of adenocarcinoma and small cell lung cancer (SCLC) have been utilized to understand mechanisms of tumor initiation, progression, and therapeutic response (Kwon and Berns, 2013).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Genetic models of SCC have only recently been generated (Ji et al., 2007;Xiao et al., 2013).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: The combination of Kras G12D expression and Lkb1 loss in the mouse lung leads to lung tumors of multiple lineages (adenocarcinoma, mixed adenosquamous, squamous, and large cell) (Jackson et al., 2001;Ji et al., 2007).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: While KRAS is commonly mutated in human lung adenocarcinomas (~21%), it is rarely altered in SCC (~6%) (Perez-Moreno et al., 2012).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: In the mouse lung, Kras G12D expression alone promotes the exclusive development of lung adenocarcinomas (Jackson et al., 2001).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: LKB1 (also known as serine/ threonine kinase 11; STK11), a tumor suppressor implicated in metabolism, cell polarity, and growth control, is lost or mutated in 5%-19% of human SCCs (Ji et al., 2007;Perez-Moreno et al., 2012;Shackelford and Shaw, 2009).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: This suggests that Lkb1 loss in the Kras G12D/+ Lkb1 fl/fl model contributes to the altered spectrum of lung tumor types, including squamous tumors.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Recently, a kinase-dead IKKα knockin mouse was reported to develop lung SCCs (Xiao et al., 2013).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: This discovery followed other mouse models with loss-of-function IKKα alleles that developed papillomas and skin SCC (Liu et al., 2012).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: The kinase-dead IKKα knockin mice develop spontaneous SCCs of the lung but also develop tumors in the skin, forestomach, and esophagus, contributing to early mortality (Xiao et al., 2013).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: When wildtype IKKα expression is restored using a skin promoter, mice survive longer and develop lung SCCs but still have defects in the forestomach and esophagus.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: These phenotypes are consistent with the observation that IKKα is downregulated in human skin SCC and in head and neck SCC (Liu et al., 2012), but the role of IKKα in lung SCC is less clear.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Copy number losses and genomic mutations in IKKα are rare in human lung SCCs, and other mechanisms of altering IKKα and its related pathways are not well defined (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: The broad spectrum of lung tumor types in Kras G12D/+ Lkb1 fl/fl mice and the extrapulmonary phenotypes in the kinase-dead IKKα mice make the study of biomarkers, mechanisms of progression, and squamous-specific therapies difficult.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: SOX2 is one of the most frequently altered genes in human SCC, amplified in ~21% and overexpressed in 60%-90% of tumors (Bass et al., 2009;Brcic et al., 2012;Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012;Hussenet et al., 2010).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: SOX2 is also frequently expressed in early-stage SCC, suggesting that SOX2 expression may be an initiating event in SCC development (Bass et al., 2009;Brcic et al., 2012;Hussenet et al., 2010).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Gain-of-function and loss-of-function studies have previously underscored a critical role for Sox2 in lung development, specifically its importance in the proliferation and differentiation of basal and neuroendocrine cells (Gontan et al., 2008;Lu et al., 2010;Que et al., 2009).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Consistent with this observation, SOX2 amplification is common in SCC and SCLC, lung tumors that are thought to originate from basal and neuroendocrine cells, respectively (Bass et al., 2009;Hussenet et al., 2010;Rudin et al., 2012).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: However, expression of Sox2 alone in the lung promotes hyperplasia and tumors of the adenocarcinoma lineage with aberrant basal cell marker expression (Lu et al., 2010).
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Although SOX2 is one of the most frequent genetic alterations associated with human SCC, it has not yet been shown to promote squamous lung tumors in vivo.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: Here, we sought to identify combinations of gene drivers that promote lung SCC.
body_text.section: © 2014 The Authors

body_text.text: RESULTS AND DISCUSSION
Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC
To identify genetic combinations that facilitate Sox2-driven SCC, we used a lentiviral approach to combine Sox2 expression with loss of distinct tumor suppressor genes.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Bicistronic lentiviruses expressing Sox2 and Cre recombinase are delivered specifically to the mouse lung using intranasal inhalation, allowing constitutive expression of two genes driven by β-Actin and Pgk promoters, respectively.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Lentiviruses are administered to mice harboring conditional LoxP-flanked ("floxed") tumor suppressor alleles to simultaneously create two genetic "hits": expression of Sox2 via the lentivirus and deletion of a tumor suppressor gene using the Cre/LoxP system ( Figure S1A).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Control cDNA (GFP) or murine Sox2 were cloned into bicistronic lentiviral vectors under control of the β-Actin promoter (referred to as Lenti-GFP-Cre or Lenti-Sox2-Cre, respectively).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Sox2 expression was validated by immunoblot analysis and Cre expression was verified using a human embryonic kidney 293T (HEK293T) reporter system that was used to calculate viral titer (Figures S1B and S1C).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Mice harboring conditional LoxP-flanked tumor suppressor alleles (Lkb1 fl/fl , p53 fl/fl , or p53 fl/fl Rb fl/fl ) were infected with Lenti-GFP-Cre or Lenti-Sox2-Cre.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: LKB1 is lost or mutated in 5%-19% of human SCCs, but loss of Lkb1 alone in the mouse lung does not lead to tumor formation (Ji et al., 2007).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: TP53 is one of the most common genetic alterations in SCC (mutated in ~81% of tumors), but loss of p53 alone in the mouse lung leads to rare adenocarcinomas after long latencies (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012;Jackson et al., 2005;Meuwissen et al., 2003).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Both TP53 and RB1 alterations are common in human SCLC (in which SOX2 is genomically amplified in ~27% of cases), and loss of p53/Rb in the mouse lung leads to SCLC after long latencies, as well as rare adenocarcinomas (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012;Meuwissen et al., 2003;Rudin et al., 2012).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: We reasoned that these tumor suppressor genes may cooperate with Sox2 expression to promote lung tumor development.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Beginning at 3 months postinfection, mice were monitored for tumor formation every month by low-dose microcomputed tomography (microCT) imaging for 7.5-12 months or until tumors were detected.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: The Sox2-Lkb1 combination had the greatest reduction in tumor-free survival compared to other genetic combinations tested ( Figure S1D).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Individual tumors were observed by microCT in all three conditional genetic backgrounds and analyzed by histopathology ( Figures 1A and  1B; Table 1).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: It is striking that most of the tumors in the Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl combination (n = 7 of 9 tumors in 17 mice) were classified as squamous tumors, as determined by analysis of hematoxylin and eosin (H&E)-stained sections by two independent pathologists ( Figure 1B; Table 1).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Sox2-Lkb1 squamous tumors exhibited characteristic SCC features, including keratin pearls and desmoplastic stroma (Brcic et al., 2012) ( Figure 1B).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Lkb1 fl/fl mice receiving Lenti-GFP-Cre did not develop tumors (n = 0 of 14 mice) as expected (Table 1).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Sox2 expression in the context of p53 loss or loss of p53/Rb did not lead to squamous lung tumors, but it did lead to a few adenocarcinomas at latencies of 5-12 months ( Table 1).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: The Sox2-Lkb1 combination exhibited significantly increased tumor incidence (Fisher's exact test, two sided, p = 0.009) and a significant enrichment in squamous tumors (89% versus 0%, Fisher's exact test, two sided, p = 0.001), compared to all other genetic combinations combined (Table 1).
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Together, these findings suggest that Sox2 expression and Lkb1 loss specifically cooperate to promote squamous tumorigenesis.
body_text.section: Lentiviral Approach to Identify Combinatorial Drivers of Lung SCC

body_text.text: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC
Expression of basal cell markers such as cytokeratin-5 (K5), -14 (K14), and P63 distinguish human SCC from adenocarcinoma (Reis-Filho et al., 2003;Terry et al., 2010).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: We analyzed tumors from each genetic combination, as well as 12 human SCCs for squamous biomarker expression.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Sox2-Lkb1 squamous tumors consistently expressed all of the basal cell markers examined (K5, K14, and p63) and were similar to human SCC, whereas adenocarcinomas in mice from other genetic combinations including Kras G12D did not (Figures 1C and 1D; Figure S2; Table 1).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Most human lung tumors express TTF1 (also known as Nkx2.1), but mean expression of TTF1 is significantly reduced in SCCs compared to adenocarcinomas and is reportedly expressed in only ~10% of SCCs (Perner et al., 2009).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Compared to Kras G12D -driven mouse adenocarcinomas that were uniformly TTF1 positive, TTF1 levels were significantly reduced in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors (Student's unpaired t test, p = 0.02) ( Figures  1C and 1D).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Sox2-Lkb1 tumors exhibited a broad spectrum of TTF1 expression, ranging from no TTF1 expression (similar to human SCCs) to higher levels of expression.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Sox2-Lkb1 tumors expressed significantly less TTF1 than mouse adenocarcinomas but significantly more TTF1 than human SCCs (Student's unpaired t test, p = 0.04) ( Figures 1C  and 1D).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Taken together, these results demonstrate that Sox2-Lkb1 tumors highly resemble human SCC at the level of histopathology and squamous biomarker expression.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Next, we sought to validate Sox2 expression and Lkb1 loss in mouse squamous tumors.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: All Sox2-Lkb1 tumors were strongly positive for nuclear Sox2 expression, similar to 75% of human SCCs (n = 9 of 12) (Figures 2A and 2B).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Kras G12D -driven adenocarcinomas and adenocarcinomas arising from other genetic combinations (p53 or p53/Rb loss) were negative for Sox2 (Figures 2A and 2B; Figure S2).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Given that the same lentiviruses were used in all experiments, this suggests that there may be a selective advantage for high Sox2 expression in the context of Lkb1 loss.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: It is interesting that Kras G12D/+ Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors had little or no Sox2 expression, suggesting that there may be Sox2-independent mechanisms of squamous tumorigenesis (Figures 2A and 2B).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Recombination of the Lkb1 allele was determined by PCR analysis on DNA from macrodissected Sox2-Lkb1 tumors.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: All tumors examined (n = 5 of 5) demonstrated the presence of the recombined Lkb1 floxed allele as well as Sox2 expression ( Figure 2C; Table 1).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Two of nine Sox2-Lkb1 tumors appeared as adenocarcinomas by H&E, and both tumors exhibited Sox2 expression and Lkb1 recombination; one tumor expressed basal cell markers and, as such, was reclassified by pathologists as squamous, whereas the other tumor did not express K5 or p63 (Table 1).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: This suggests that Sox2 expression and Lkb1 loss may not be sufficient for squamous tumorigenesis in all contexts and/or that this adenocarcinoma represents an intermediate state that has the potential to trans-differentiate to a squamous tumor under certain conditions (Han et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: LKB1 phosphorylates and activates adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase (AMPK), which negatively regulates the mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR) pathway.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Immunohistochemical (IHC) analysis of Sox2-Lkb1 tumors demonstrated an absence of phosphorylated AMPK (pAMPK) and enhanced expression of phosphorylated eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E-binding protein 1 (p4EBP1), an mTOR substrate (Hay and Sonenberg, 2004;Perner et al., 2009), con-firming activation of the mTOR pathway (Figures 2A and 2B).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: The mTOR pathway is frequently activated in human lung SCCs and represents a potential therapeutic target (Mantripragada and Khurshid, 2013).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Indeed, we observed that, of the human SCCs with strong SOX2 expression (9 of 12), five demonstrated evidence of mTOR pathway activation as well (55% of Sox2+ SCCs) ( Figure 2D).
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Altogether, these data reveal that SOX2 expression and mTOR activity frequently co-occur in human SCC and that Sox2-Lkb1 tumors strongly resemble human SCCs at the level of pathway activation.
body_text.section: Lenti-Sox2-Cre Lkb1 fl/fl Tumors Express Biomarkers of Human SCC

body_text.text: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

To identify pathways dysregulated in Sox2-driven SCC, we performed IHC analysis for therapeutically relevant pathways in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors, Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors identified by K5 staining, and human SCCs.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: FGFR family members are frequently amplified and/or harbor activating point mutations in human SCC, and FGFR inhibitors are currently in clinical trials (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012; Dutt et al., 2011;Liao et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Notably, SOX2 and FGFR2 expression are highly correlated in human SCC, and SOX2 can bind the FGFR2 promoter (Bass et al., 2009;Boyer et al., 2005;Fang et al., 2011), suggesting that FGFR2 may be a direct target of SOX2 in lung cancer.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We examined expression of FGFR2 in each tumor group and found that Fgfr2 expression tended to be higher in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors compared to Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors, but these data did not reach statistical significance ( Figures 3A and 3B).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: FGFR2 was highly induced by SOX2 expression in human A549 lung cancer cells harboring LKB1 mutations ( Figure S3) but not in two other cell lines with LKB1 mutations (H23 and H157) (Mahoney et al., 2009; Figure S3).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We were not able to detect phospho-Frs or pFGFR2 in the Sox2-Lkb1 tumors, so it remains to be determined whether pathways downstream of FGFR2 are activated.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: The nuclear factor κB (NF-κB) pathway is activated and implicated in various cancers, including lung adenocarcinoma (Meylan et al., 2009;Xue et al., 2011) and lung SCC (Xiao et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Sox2-Lkb1 tumors demonstrated evidence of NF-κB pathway activity as indicated by nuclear p65, similar to Kras-driven adenocarcinomas ( Figure S3).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Although, the role of NF-κB signaling in SCC development remains to be determined, activation of this pathway in multiple mouse models of SCC warrants further study of NF-κB as a potential therapeutic target.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Inducible SOX2 expression alone was not sufficient to increase nuclear p65 in human cell lines regardless of LKB1 status, suggesting that other factors are likely driving NF-κB signaling in these cells ( Figure 3C).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: The RAS/MAPK/PI3K pathways are frequently activated in human squamous tumors via different mechanisms (Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network, 2012).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: To examine the status of these pathways, we stained tumors for pErk and pAkt.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Notably, pErk was significantly reduced in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors compared to Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors and human SCCs ( Figures 3A and 3B).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We speculate that Kras activation in Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors maintains pErk signaling, which is absent in Sox2driven tumors.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We observed variable levels of pAkt in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors, ranging from little or no pAkt to high levels similar to those in Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl tumors ( Figures 3A and 3B).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Together, Sox2-Lkb1 tumors had reduced MAPK pathway activity compared to Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors, suggesting that Sox2-Lkb1 tumors may rely more heavily on other growth factor signaling pathways for proliferation, including mTOR.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: A recent study published while this article was under consideration demonstrated that Pten loss cooperates with Lkb1 loss to promote SCC (Xu et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Notably, Pten/Lkb1-null tumors also exhibited low MAPK pathway activation.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Stat3 has been shown to cooperate with Sox2 to promote tumor progression in esophageal and forestomach tumors, cancers in which SOX2 is genomically amplified (Liu et al., 2013).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Preclinical studies have identified STAT3 inhibitors, and STAT3 decoys are now being tested in patients with head and neck SCC (Sen et al., 2012).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Compared to Kras G12D adenocarcinomas and Kras G12D Lkb1 fl/fl squamous tumors, the Jak-Stat pathway was significantly activated in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors (indicated by phospho-Stat3) with clear nuclear pStat3 in some cells within the squamous tumors ( Figures 3A and 3B).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Human SCCs had variable levels of pStat3 similar to those in Sox2-Lkb1 tumors (Figures 3A and 3B).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: It is striking that, in multiple human lung cancer cell lines of adenocarcinoma and squamous lineage, inducible expression of SOX2 consistently promoted nuclear pStat3 accumulation ( Figure 3C).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Altogether, these data suggest that Sox2 contributes to Stat signaling in vivo and thus represents a therapeutic target warranting further investigation for SCC treatment.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: To summarize, we have used a lentiviral-based approach to generate a mouse model of SCC based on Sox2 expression and Lkb1 loss, highlighting their cooperation in lung SCC development.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Both SOX2 expression and mTOR pathway activity frequently co-occur in human SCC, making this model particularly relevant to the human disease.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Mouse tumors recapitulate the human disease at the level of histopathology, biomarker expression, and activation of potential therapeutic targets that have been largely unexplored in SCC treatment.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: It is important to note that Stat signaling was induced by SOX2 in vitro and enriched in Sox2-driven squamous tumors.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: This model thus serves as a preclinical tool to test whether STAT inhibition is therapeutically effective against Sox2-driven SCCs.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: The low penetrance of tumor formation in this model may be due to low lentiviral titer and/or the underlying cell of origin.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Although we recognize that tumor numbers in this study are low, the paucity of other squamous lung tumor models suggests that this particular genetic combination is highly relevant.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: While this article was under consideration, Xu et al. demonstrated that Pten/Lkb1 loss promotes squamous lung tumors exclusively, in contrast to Kras/Lkb1 mice, which develop multiple tumor types (Ji et al., 2007;Xu et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: It remains unknown why PI3K activation, as opposed to MAPK, would lead exclusively to squamous tumors in the context of Lkb1 loss, especially since PI3K pathway alterations also occur in adenocarcinoma (Ding et al., 2008).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We speculate that, since Pten/Lkb1-null tumors express Sox2, Sox2 may be a critical target of the PI3K pathway in these tumors.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: In both Pten/Lkb1 and Sox2/Lkb1 mouse models, inflammatory microenvironment and activation of immune signaling pathways appear to distinguish SCC from adenocarcinoma (Xu et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: A notable difference between the two models is that adenoviruses used in Pten/Lkb1 and Kras/Lkb1 models are thought to enhance inflammation compared to lentiviruses used here.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: These models will serve as preclinical tools for further investigation of immunotherapy efficacy and function.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: It is unclear whether SCCs arise from basal cells or whether the transforming events promote basal cell differentiation.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: The identity of the cell of origin for SCC remains an important unanswered question.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: One model suggests that basal cells serve as the cells of origin because SCCs express basal cell markers and Sox2 is expressed in basal cells (Que et al., 2009;Sutherland and Berns, 2010).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: However, other studies suggest that Sox2 promotes basal cell fate (Han et al., 2014;Lu et al., 2010).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Recent studies in Kras G12D/+ Lkb1 fl/fl mice suggest that type II pneumocyte-derived lung adenocarcinomas can transdifferentiate into SCCs (Han et al., 2014).
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Given that lentiviruses in our model may target multiple cell types in the mouse lung, it is possible that Sox2 expression and Lkb1 loss are capable of altering cell fate to a squamous-like identity.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Given that we also detected one tumor that appeared as an adenocarcinoma expressing basal cell markers, we speculate that transdifferentiation may also occur in this model.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: The lentiviral approach used here could be adapted to investigate the cell of origin for Sox2-driven SCCs.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Bicistronic lentiviruses may also be used to test other candidate SCC drivers, such as P63 and NRF2, as well as to identify cooperating genetic events that promote SCC.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: We expect that murine squamous tumors will have fewer "passenger" genetic alterations than human SCC due to lack of carcinogen exposure, thereby providing a biological filter to identify "driver" genetic changes in SCC.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: Beyond lung cancer, findings from this model may have important clinical implications for other squamous or SOX2-driven malignancies such as SCLC and brain, esophageal, and oral cancers.
body_text.section: Sox2-Driven SCCs Exhibit Expression or Activation of Potential Therapeutic Targets

body_text.text: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections
Mice were housed in an environmentally controlled room according to the Committee of Animal Care.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: Lkb1 fl/fl mice were purchased from The Jackson Laboratory.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: LSL-Kras G12D/+ and p53 fl/fl animals were kindly provided by Tyler Jacks.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: p53 fl/fl Rb fl/fl mice were generated by Anton Berns (Meuwissen et al., 2003) and obtained from T. Jacks.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: Lung tumor tissue from Kras G12D/+ Lkb1 fl/fl mice was kindly provided by Reuben Shaw.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: At 6-8 weeks of age, anesthetized mice were infected with ~10 7 infectious units/ml of Lenti-Sox2-Cre or GFP-Cre lentiviruses or 6.47 ~10 7 plaque-forming units of AdCre (University of Iowa) by nasal instillation as described elsewhere (Jackson et al., 2001).
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: Viruses were administered in a Biosafety Level 2+ room according to Institutional Biosafety Committee guidelines.
body_text.section: EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES Mouse Breeding and Lentiviral Infections

body_text.text: Lentivirus Production
GFP and murine Sox2 cDNAs were cloned into bicistronic lentiviral vectors expressing Cre to generate Lenti-Sox2-Cre and Lenti-GFP-Cre plasmids and confirmed by direct sequencing.
body_text.section: Lentivirus Production

body_text.text: 293T cells were transfected with a three-plasmid transfection system including the lentiviral vector, pCMV-delta-8.2 (Addgene) and pCMV-VSV-G (Addgene).
body_text.section: Lentivirus Production

body_text.text: Virus was harvested posttransfection, concentrated by ultracentrifugation (24,000 × g), and titered using HEK293T reporter cells stably expressing a Lox-DsRed2(Stop)-Lox-GFP cassette.
body_text.section: Lentivirus Production

body_text.text: Number of cells expressing green fluorescent protein was measured by flow cytometry and used to calculate titer (infectious U/ml).
body_text.section: Lentivirus Production

body_text.text: MicroCT Imaging
At indicated time points, mice were scanned for 30 s to 2 min under isoflurane anesthesia using a small animal Quantum FX microCT (PerkinElmer) at 45 υm resolution, 90 kV, with 160 υA current.
body_text.section: MicroCT Imaging

body_text.text: Images were acquired using PerkinElmer Quantum FX software and processed with Analyze 11.0 (AnalyzeDirect).
body_text.section: MicroCT Imaging

body_text.text: Human Tissue
Excess deidentified fresh tissue was obtained with prior patient consent under approved protocol by the institutional review board (#10924).
body_text.section: Human Tissue

body_text.text: Institutional guidelines regarding specimen use were followed.
body_text.section: Human Tissue

body_text.text: Detailed histopathology, biomarker staining, Lkb1 recombination results, and latency of tumors are identified in mice receiving GFP or Sox2 lentiviruses in indicated conditional genetic backgrounds.
